026 package de.general.json;
027 
028 
029 import java.io.IOException;
030 import java.io.StringWriter;
031 import java.io.Writer;
032 import java.lang.reflect.Array;
033 import java.util.ArrayList;
034 import java.util.Collection;
035 import java.util.Iterator;
036 import java.util.Map;
037 
038 
039 /**
040 * A JSONArray is an ordered sequence of values. Its external text form is a
041 * string wrapped in square brackets with commas separating the values. The
042 * internal form is an object having <code>get</code> and <code>opt</code>
043 * methods for accessing the values by index, and <code>put</code> methods for
044 * adding or replacing values. The values can be any of these types:
045 * <code>Boolean</code>, <code>JSONArray</code>, <code>JSONObject</code>,
046 * <code>Number</code>, <code>String</code>, or the
047 * <code>JSONObject.NULL object</code>.
048 * <p>
049 * The constructor can convert a JSON text into a Java object. The
050 * <code>toString</code> method converts to JSON text.
051 * <p>
052 * A <code>get</code> method returns a value if one can be found, and throws an
053 * exception if one cannot be found. An <code>opt</code> method returns a
054 * default value instead of throwing an exception, and so is useful for
055 * obtaining optional values.
056 * <p>
057 * The generic <code>get()</code> and <code>opt()</code> methods return an
058 * object which you can cast or query for type. There are also typed
059 * <code>get</code> and <code>opt</code> methods that do type checking and type
060 * coercion for you.
061 * <p>
062 * The texts produced by the <code>toString</code> methods strictly conform to
063 * JSON syntax rules. The constructors are more forgiving in the texts they will
064 * accept:
065 * <ul>
066 * <li>An extra <code>,</code>&nbsp;<small>(comma)</small> may appear just
067 * before the closing bracket.</li>
068 * <li>The <code>null</code> value will be inserted when there is <code>,</code>
069 * &nbsp;<small>(comma)</small> elision.</li>
070 * <li>Strings may be quoted with <code>'</code>&nbsp;<small>(single
071 * quote)</small>.</li>
072 * <li>Strings do not need to be quoted at all if they do not begin with a quote
073 * or single quote, and if they do not contain leading or trailing spaces, and
074 * if they do not contain any of these characters:
075 * <code>{ } [ ] / \ : , #</code> and if they do not look like numbers and
076 * if they are not the reserved words <code>true</code>, <code>false</code>, or
077 * <code>null</code>.</li>
078 * </ul>
079 *
080 * @author JSON.org
081 * @version 2013-04-18
082 */
083 class JSONArray
084 {
085 
086     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
087     // Constants
088     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
089 
090     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
091     // Variables
092     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
093 
094     /**
095     * The arrayList where the JSONArray's properties are kept.
096     */
097     private final ArrayList myArrayList;
098 
099     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
100     // Constructors
101     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
102 
103     /**
104     * Construct an empty JSONArray.
105     */
106     protected JSONArray() {
107         this.myArrayList = new ArrayList();
108     }
109 
110     /**
111     * Construct a JSONArray from a JSONTokener.
112     *
113     * @param x
114     * A JSONTokener
115     * @throws JSONException
116     * If there is a syntax error.
117     */
118     protected JSONArray(JSONTokener x) throws JSONException {
119         this();
120         if (x.nextClean() != '[') {
121             throw x.syntaxError("A JSONArray text must start with '['");
122         }
123         if (x.nextClean() != ']') {
124             x.back();
125             for (;;) {
126                 if (x.nextClean() == ',') {
127                     x.back();
128                     this.myArrayList.add(JSONObject.NULL);
129                 } else {
130                     x.back();
131                     this.myArrayList.add(x.nextValue());
132                 }
133                 switch (x.nextClean()) {
134                 case ',':
135                     if (x.nextClean() == ']') {
136                         return;
137                     }
138                     x.back();
139                     break;
140                 case ']':
141                     return;
142                 default:
143                     throw x.syntaxError("Expected a ',' or ']'");
144                 }
145             }
146         }
147     }
148 
149     /**
150     * Construct a JSONArray from a source JSON text.
151     *
152     * @param source
153     * A string that begins with <code>[</code>&nbsp;<small>(left
154     * bracket)</small> and ends with <code>]</code>
155     * &nbsp;<small>(right bracket)</small>.
156     * @throws JSONException
157     * If there is a syntax error.
158     */
159     public JSONArray(String source) throws JSONException {
160         this(new JSONTokener(source));
161     }
162 
163     /**
164     * Construct a JSONArray from a Collection.
165     *
166     * @param collection
167     * A Collection.
168     */
169     public JSONArray(Collection collection) {
170         this.myArrayList = new ArrayList();
171         if (collection != null) {
172             Iterator iter = collection.iterator();
173             while (iter.hasNext()) {
174                 this.myArrayList.add(JSONObject.wrap(iter.next()));
175             }
176         }
177     }
178 
179     /**
180     * Construct a JSONArray from an array
181     *
182     * @throws JSONException
183     * If not an array.
184     */
185     public JSONArray(Object array) throws JSONException {
186         this();
187         if (array.getClass().isArray()) {
188             int length = Array.getLength(array);
189             for (int i = 0; i < length; i += 1) {
190                 this.put(JSONObject.wrap(Array.get(array, i)));
191             }
192         } else {
193             throw new JSONException(
194                     "JSONArray initial value should be a string or collection or array.");
195         }
196     }
197 
198     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
199     // Methods
200     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
201 
202      /**
203     * Get the object value associated with an index.
204     *
205     * @param index
206     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
207     * @return An object value.
208     * @throws JSONException
209     * If there is no value for the index.
210     */
211     public Object get(int index) throws JSONException {
212         Object object = this.opt(index);
213         if (object == null) {
214             throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] not found.");
215         }
216         return object;
217     }
218 
219     /**
220     * Get the boolean value associated with an index. The string values "true"
221     * and "false" are converted to boolean.
222     *
223     * @param index
224     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
225     * @return The truth.
226     * @throws JSONException
227     * If there is no value for the index or if the value is not
228     * convertible to boolean.
229     */
230     public boolean getBoolean(int index) throws JSONException {
231         Object object = this.get(index);
232         if (object.equals(Boolean.FALSE)
233                 || (object instanceof String && ((String) object)
234                         .equalsIgnoreCase("false"))) {
235             return false;
236         } else if (object.equals(Boolean.TRUE)
237                 || (object instanceof String && ((String) object)
238                         .equalsIgnoreCase("true"))) {
239             return true;
240         }
241         throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] is not a boolean.");
242     }
243 
244     /**
245     * Get the double value associated with an index.
246     *
247     * @param index
248     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
249     * @return The value.
250     * @throws JSONException
251     * If the key is not found or if the value cannot be converted
252     * to a number.
253     */
254     public double getDouble(int index) throws JSONException {
255         Object object = this.get(index);
256         try {
257             return object instanceof Number ? ((Number) object).doubleValue()
258                     : Double.parseDouble((String) object);
259         } catch (Exception e) {
260             throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] is not a number.");
261         }
262     }
263 
264     /**
265     * Get the int value associated with an index.
266     *
267     * @param index
268     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
269     * @return The value.
270     * @throws JSONException
271     * If the key is not found or if the value is not a number.
272     */
273     public int getInt(int index) throws JSONException {
274         Object object = this.get(index);
275         try {
276             return object instanceof Number ? ((Number) object).intValue()
277                     : Integer.parseInt((String) object);
278         } catch (Exception e) {
279             throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] is not a number.");
280         }
281     }
282 
283     /**
284     * Get the JSONArray associated with an index.
285     *
286     * @param index
287     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
288     * @return A JSONArray value.
289     * @throws JSONException
290     * If there is no value for the index. or if the value is not a
291     * JSONArray
292     */
293     public JSONArray getJSONArray(int index) throws JSONException {
294         Object object = this.get(index);
295         if (object instanceof JSONArray) {
296             return (JSONArray) object;
297         }
298         throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] is not a JSONArray.");
299     }
300 
301     /**
302     * Get the JSONObject associated with an index.
303     *
304     * @param index
305     * subscript
306     * @return A JSONObject value.
307     * @throws JSONException
308     * If there is no value for the index or if the value is not a
309     * JSONObject
310     */
311     public JSONObject getJSONObject(int index) throws JSONException {
312         Object object = this.get(index);
313         if (object instanceof JSONObject) {
314             return (JSONObject) object;
315         }
316         throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] is not a JSONObject.");
317     }
318 
319     /**
320     * Get the long value associated with an index.
321     *
322     * @param index
323     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
324     * @return The value.
325     * @throws JSONException
326     * If the key is not found or if the value cannot be converted
327     * to a number.
328     */
329     public long getLong(int index) throws JSONException {
330         Object object = this.get(index);
331         try {
332             return object instanceof Number ? ((Number) object).longValue()
333                     : Long.parseLong((String) object);
334         } catch (Exception e) {
335             throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] is not a number.");
336         }
337     }
338 
339     /**
340     * Get the string associated with an index.
341     *
342     * @param index
343     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
344     * @return A string value.
345     * @throws JSONException
346     * If there is no string value for the index.
347     */
348     public String getString(int index) throws JSONException {
349         Object object = this.get(index);
350         if (object instanceof String) {
351             return (String) object;
352         }
353         throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] not a string.");
354     }
355 
356     /**
357     * Determine if the value is null.
358     *
359     * @param index
360     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
361     * @return true if the value at the index is null, or if there is no value.
362     */
363     public boolean isNull(int index) {
364         return JSONObject.NULL.equals(this.opt(index));
365     }
366 
367     /**
368     * Make a string from the contents of this JSONArray. The
369     * <code>separator</code> string is inserted between each element. Warning:
370     * This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
371     *
372     * @param separator
373     * A string that will be inserted between the elements.
374     * @return a string.
375     * @throws JSONException
376     * If the array contains an invalid number.
377     */
378     public String join(String separator) throws JSONException {
379         int len = this.length();
380         StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
381 
382         for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 1) {
383             if (i > 0) {
384                 sb.append(separator);
385             }
386             sb.append(JSONObject.valueToString(this.myArrayList.get(i)));
387         }
388         return sb.toString();
389     }
390 
391     /**
392     * Get the number of elements in the JSONArray, included nulls.
393     *
394     * @return The length (or size).
395     */
396     public int length() {
397         return this.myArrayList.size();
398     }
399 
400     /**
401     * Get the optional object value associated with an index.
402     *
403     * @param index
404     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
405     * @return An object value, or null if there is no object at that index.
406     */
407     public Object opt(int index) {
408         return (index < 0 || index >= this.length()) ? null : this.myArrayList
409                 .get(index);
410     }
411 
412     /**
413     * Get the optional boolean value associated with an index. It returns false
414     * if there is no value at that index, or if the value is not Boolean.TRUE
415     * or the String "true".
416     *
417     * @param index
418     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
419     * @return The truth.
420     */
421     public boolean optBoolean(int index) {
422         return this.optBoolean(index, false);
423     }
424 
425     /**
426     * Get the optional boolean value associated with an index. It returns the
427     * defaultValue if there is no value at that index or if it is not a Boolean
428     * or the String "true" or "false" (case insensitive).
429     *
430     * @param index
431     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
432     * @param defaultValue
433     * A boolean default.
434     * @return The truth.
435     */
436     public boolean optBoolean(int index, boolean defaultValue) {
437         try {
438             return this.getBoolean(index);
439         } catch (Exception e) {
440             return defaultValue;
441         }
442     }
443 
444     /**
445     * Get the optional double value associated with an index. NaN is returned
446     * if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and
447     * cannot be converted to a number.
448     *
449     * @param index
450     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
451     * @return The value.
452     */
453     public double optDouble(int index) {
454         return this.optDouble(index, Double.NaN);
455     }
456 
457     /**
458     * Get the optional double value associated with an index. The defaultValue
459     * is returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a
460     * number and cannot be converted to a number.
461     *
462     * @param index
463     * subscript
464     * @param defaultValue
465     * The default value.
466     * @return The value.
467     */
468     public double optDouble(int index, double defaultValue) {
469         try {
470             return this.getDouble(index);
471         } catch (Exception e) {
472             return defaultValue;
473         }
474     }
475 
476     /**
477     * Get the optional int value associated with an index. Zero is returned if
478     * there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and
479     * cannot be converted to a number.
480     *
481     * @param index
482     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
483     * @return The value.
484     */
485     public int optInt(int index) {
486         return this.optInt(index, 0);
487     }
488 
489     /**
490     * Get the optional int value associated with an index. The defaultValue is
491     * returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a
492     * number and cannot be converted to a number.
493     *
494     * @param index
495     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
496     * @param defaultValue
497     * The default value.
498     * @return The value.
499     */
500     public int optInt(int index, int defaultValue) {
501         try {
502             return this.getInt(index);
503         } catch (Exception e) {
504             return defaultValue;
505         }
506     }
507 
508     /**
509     * Get the optional JSONArray associated with an index.
510     *
511     * @param index
512     * subscript
513     * @return A JSONArray value, or null if the index has no value, or if the
514     * value is not a JSONArray.
515     */
516     public JSONArray optJSONArray(int index) {
517         Object o = this.opt(index);
518         return o instanceof JSONArray ? (JSONArray) o : null;
519     }
520 
521     /**
522     * Get the optional JSONObject associated with an index. Null is returned if
523     * the key is not found, or null if the index has no value, or if the value
524     * is not a JSONObject.
525     *
526     * @param index
527     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
528     * @return A JSONObject value.
529     */
530     public JSONObject optJSONObject(int index) {
531         Object o = this.opt(index);
532         return o instanceof JSONObject ? (JSONObject) o : null;
533     }
534 
535     /**
536     * Get the optional long value associated with an index. Zero is returned if
537     * there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and
538     * cannot be converted to a number.
539     *
540     * @param index
541     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
542     * @return The value.
543     */
544     public long optLong(int index) {
545         return this.optLong(index, 0);
546     }
547 
548     /**
549     * Get the optional long value associated with an index. The defaultValue is
550     * returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a
551     * number and cannot be converted to a number.
552     *
553     * @param index
554     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
555     * @param defaultValue
556     * The default value.
557     * @return The value.
558     */
559     public long optLong(int index, long defaultValue) {
560         try {
561             return this.getLong(index);
562         } catch (Exception e) {
563             return defaultValue;
564         }
565     }
566 
567     /**
568     * Get the optional string value associated with an index. It returns an
569     * empty string if there is no value at that index. If the value is not a
570     * string and is not null, then it is coverted to a string.
571     *
572     * @param index
573     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
574     * @return A String value.
575     */
576     public String optString(int index) {
577         return this.optString(index, "");
578     }
579 
580     /**
581     * Get the optional string associated with an index. The defaultValue is
582     * returned if the key is not found.
583     *
584     * @param index
585     * The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
586     * @param defaultValue
587     * The default value.
588     * @return A String value.
589     */
590     public String optString(int index, String defaultValue) {
591         Object object = this.opt(index);
592         return JSONObject.NULL.equals(object) ? defaultValue : object
593                 .toString();
594     }
595 
596     /**
597     * Append a boolean value. This increases the array's length by one.
598     *
599     * @param value
600     * A boolean value.
601     * @return this.
602     */
603     public JSONArray put(boolean value) {
604         this.put(value ? Boolean.TRUE : Boolean.FALSE);
605         return this;
606     }
607 
608     /**
609     * Put a value in the JSONArray, where the value will be a JSONArray which
610     * is produced from a Collection.
611     *
612     * @param value
613     * A Collection value.
614     * @return this.
615     */
616     public JSONArray put(Collection value) {
617         this.put(new JSONArray(value));
618         return this;
619     }
620 
621     /**
622     * Append a double value. This increases the array's length by one.
623     *
624     * @param value
625     * A double value.
626     * @throws JSONException
627     * if the value is not finite.
628     * @return this.
629     */
630     public JSONArray put(double value) throws JSONException {
631         Double d = new Double(value);
632         JSONObject.testValidity(d);
633         this.put(d);
634         return this;
635     }
636 
637     /**
638     * Append an int value. This increases the array's length by one.
639     *
640     * @param value
641     * An int value.
642     * @return this.
643     */
644     public JSONArray put(int value) {
645         this.put(new Integer(value));
646         return this;
647     }
648 
649     /**
650     * Append an long value. This increases the array's length by one.
651     *
652     * @param value
653     * A long value.
654     * @return this.
655     */
656     public JSONArray put(long value) {
657         this.put(new Long(value));
658         return this;
659     }
660 
661     /**
662     * Put a value in the JSONArray, where the value will be a JSONObject which
663     * is produced from a Map.
664     *
665     * @param value
666     * A Map value.
667     * @return this.
668     */
669     public JSONArray put(Map value) {
670         this.put(new JSONObject(value));
671         return this;
672     }
673 
674     /**
675     * Append an object value. This increases the array's length by one.
676     *
677     * @param value
678     * An object value. The value should be a Boolean, Double,
679     * Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, or String, or the
680     * JSONObject.NULL object.
681     * @return this.
682     */
683     public JSONArray put(Object value) {
684         this.myArrayList.add(value);
685         return this;
686     }
687 
688     /**
689     * Put or replace a boolean value in the JSONArray. If the index is greater
690     * than the length of the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as
691     * necessary to pad it out.
692     *
693     * @param index
694     * The subscript.
695     * @param value
696     * A boolean value.
697     * @return this.
698     * @throws JSONException
699     * If the index is negative.
700     */
701     public JSONArray put(int index, boolean value) throws JSONException {
702         this.put(index, value ? Boolean.TRUE : Boolean.FALSE);
703         return this;
704     }
705 
706     /**
707     * Put a value in the JSONArray, where the value will be a JSONArray which
708     * is produced from a Collection.
709     *
710     * @param index
711     * The subscript.
712     * @param value
713     * A Collection value.
714     * @return this.
715     * @throws JSONException
716     * If the index is negative or if the value is not finite.
717     */
718     public JSONArray put(int index, Collection value) throws JSONException {
719         this.put(index, new JSONArray(value));
720         return this;
721     }
722 
723     /**
724     * Put or replace a double value. If the index is greater than the length of
725     * the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it
726     * out.
727     *
728     * @param index
729     * The subscript.
730     * @param value
731     * A double value.
732     * @return this.
733     * @throws JSONException
734     * If the index is negative or if the value is not finite.
735     */
736     public JSONArray put(int index, double value) throws JSONException {
737         this.put(index, new Double(value));
738         return this;
739     }
740 
741     /**
742     * Put or replace an int value. If the index is greater than the length of
743     * the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it
744     * out.
745     *
746     * @param index
747     * The subscript.
748     * @param value
749     * An int value.
750     * @return this.
751     * @throws JSONException
752     * If the index is negative.
753     */
754     public JSONArray put(int index, int value) throws JSONException {
755         this.put(index, new Integer(value));
756         return this;
757     }
758 
759     /**
760     * Put or replace a long value. If the index is greater than the length of
761     * the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it
762     * out.
763     *
764     * @param index
765     * The subscript.
766     * @param value
767     * A long value.
768     * @return this.
769     * @throws JSONException
770     * If the index is negative.
771     */
772     public JSONArray put(int index, long value) throws JSONException {
773         this.put(index, new Long(value));
774         return this;
775     }
776 
777     /**
778     * Put a value in the JSONArray, where the value will be a JSONObject that
779     * is produced from a Map.
780     *
781     * @param index
782     * The subscript.
783     * @param value
784     * The Map value.
785     * @return this.
786     * @throws JSONException
787     * If the index is negative or if the the value is an invalid
788     * number.
789     */
790     public JSONArray put(int index, Map value) throws JSONException {
791         this.put(index, new JSONObject(value));
792         return this;
793     }
794 
795     /**
796     * Put or replace an object value in the JSONArray. If the index is greater
797     * than the length of the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as
798     * necessary to pad it out.
799     *
800     * @param index
801     * The subscript.
802     * @param value
803     * The value to put into the array. The value should be a
804     * Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, or
805     * String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.
806     * @return this.
807     * @throws JSONException
808     * If the index is negative or if the the value is an invalid
809     * number.
810     */
811     public JSONArray put(int index, Object value) throws JSONException {
812         JSONObject.testValidity(value);
813         if (index < 0) {
814             throw new JSONException("JSONArray[" + index + "] not found.");
815         }
816         if (index < this.length()) {
817             this.myArrayList.set(index, value);
818         } else {
819             while (index != this.length()) {
820                 this.put(JSONObject.NULL);
821             }
822             this.put(value);
823         }
824         return this;
825     }
826 
827     /**
828     * Remove an index and close the hole.
829     *
830     * @param index
831     * The index of the element to be removed.
832     * @return The value that was associated with the index, or null if there
833     * was no value.
834     */
835     public Object remove(int index) {
836         Object o = this.opt(index);
837         this.myArrayList.remove(index);
838         return o;
839     }
840 
841     /**
842     * Produce a JSONObject by combining a JSONArray of names with the values of
843     * this JSONArray.
844     *
845     * @param names
846     * A JSONArray containing a list of key strings. These will be
847     * paired with the values.
848     * @return A JSONObject, or null if there are no names or if this JSONArray
849     * has no values.
850     * @throws JSONException
851     * If any of the names are null.
852     */
853     public JSONObject toJSONObject(JSONArray names) throws JSONException {
854         if (names == null || names.length() == 0 || this.length() == 0) {
855             return null;
856         }
857         JSONObject jo = new JSONObject();
858         for (int i = 0; i < names.length(); i += 1) {
859             jo.put(names.getString(i), this.opt(i));
860         }
861         return jo;
862     }
863 
864     /**
865     * Make a JSON text of this JSONArray. For compactness, no unnecessary
866     * whitespace is added. If it is not possible to produce a syntactically
867     * correct JSON text then null will be returned instead. This could occur if
868     * the array contains an invalid number.
869     * <p>
870     * Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
871     *
872     * @return a printable, displayable, transmittable representation of the
873     * array.
874     */
875     public String toString() {
876         try {
877             return this.toString(0);
878         } catch (Exception e) {
879             return null;
880         }
881     }
882 
883     /**
884     * Make a prettyprinted JSON text of this JSONArray. Warning: This method
885     * assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
886     *
887     * @param indentFactor
888     * The number of spaces to add to each level of indentation.
889     * @return a printable, displayable, transmittable representation of the
890     * object, beginning with <code>[</code>&nbsp;<small>(left
891     * bracket)</small> and ending with <code>]</code>
892     * &nbsp;<small>(right bracket)</small>.
893     * @throws JSONException
894     */
895     public String toString(int indentFactor) throws JSONException {
896         StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
897         synchronized (sw.getBuffer()) {
898             return this.write(sw, indentFactor, 0).toString();
899         }
900     }
901 
902     /**
903     * Write the contents of the JSONArray as JSON text to a writer. For
904     * compactness, no whitespace is added.
905     * <p>
906     * Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
907     *
908     * @return The writer.
909     * @throws JSONException
910     */
911     public Writer write(Writer writer) throws JSONException {
912         return this.write(writer, 0, 0);
913     }
914 
915     /**
916     * Write the contents of the JSONArray as JSON text to a writer. For
917     * compactness, no whitespace is added.
918     * <p>
919     * Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
920     *
921     * @param indentFactor
922     * The number of spaces to add to each level of indentation.
923     * @param indent
924     * The indention of the top level.
925     * @return The writer.
926     * @throws JSONException
927     */
928     Writer write(Writer writer, int indentFactor, int indent)
929             throws JSONException {
930         try {
931             boolean commanate = false;
932             int length = this.length();
933             writer.write('[');
934 
935             if (length == 1) {
936                 JSONObject.writeValue(writer, this.myArrayList.get(0),
937                         indentFactor, indent);
938             } else if (length != 0) {
939                 final int newindent = indent + indentFactor;
940 
941                 for (int i = 0; i < length; i += 1) {
942                     if (commanate) {
943                         writer.write(',');
944                     }
945                     if (indentFactor > 0) {
946                         writer.write('\n');
947                     }
948                     JSONObject.indent(writer, newindent);
949                     JSONObject.writeValue(writer, this.myArrayList.get(i),
950                             indentFactor, newindent);
951                     commanate = true;
952                 }
953                 if (indentFactor > 0) {
954                     writer.write('\n');
955                 }
956                 JSONObject.indent(writer, indent);
957             }
958             writer.write(']');
959             return writer;
960         } catch (IOException e) {
961             throw new JSONException(e);
962         }
963     }
964 
965 }
  JavaDoq: JSONArray.java
